Subjective: Spot on neck for 2 weeks; started after shaving and insect bite. Swollen, redder, scabs falling off; itchy. No pain. Past warts but no other similar spots. Family history of skin malignancies (father's side). Concern about skin cancer. Request advice and treatment.
Objective: Raised, pinkish-red lesion, ~0.5 cm, redder center. No scab. No similar spots elsewhere.
Assessment: Possible pyogenic granuloma or atypical mole. No signs of melanoma.
Plan: Discuss treatment options: freezing, removal, scraping.
